title: Generative coding: 10 Breakthrough Technologies 2026
description: MIT Technology Review named generative AI's ability to write software code as one of the 10 Breakthrough Technologies of 2026. The article discusses how generative coding has quickly created one of technology's first real use cases for business, transforming how software is developed.
author: MIT Technology Review

title: Most dubious uses of AI at CES 2026
description: The Verge covers the most questionable AI applications showcased at CES 2026, noting that 'AI is everywhere, but it really shouldn't be' and examining problematic implementations of AI technology.

title: LLM predictions for 2026, shared with Oxide and Friends
description: Simon Willison shared his 1, 3, and 6-year predictions for AI and LLMs on the Oxide and Friends podcast. Key predictions include: (1 year) It will become undeniable that LLMs write good code; We'll finally solve sandboxing; A 'Challenger disaster' for coding agent security. (3 years) The coding agents Jevons paradox will resolve; Someone will build a new browser using mainly AI-assisted coding. (6 years) Typing code by hand will go the way of punch cards - software engineers won't spend hours typing syntax, but will focus on higher-level skills.
author: Simon Willison

title: 12 AI Coding Emerging Trends That Will Dominate 2026
description: Article covering transformations in the AI coding space including spec-driven development, new workflow patterns, and emerging tools that will shape how developers write code in 2026.
author: AI Software Engineer (Medium)

title: What's next for AI in 2026
description: MIT Technology Review explores key AI trends for 2026, including predictions that more Silicon Valley products will be built on Chinese LLMs and the US will face another year of regulatory tug-of-war over AI governance.
author: MIT Technology Review

title: My LLM coding workflow going into 2026
